thread.title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/28): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big day propels Horned Frogs to win
thread.title_full: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/28): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big day propels Horned Frogs to win | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/28): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big day propels Horned Frogs to win
text:
Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week
Josh Doctson, TCU WR
Height: 6-foot-3
Weight: 195 pounds
Class: Senior
Season Stats: 35 catches, 593 yards, six touchdowns
Why he deserves it: The Horned Frogs were without senior wide receiver Kolby Listenbee against Texas Tech but they got a big performance from Doctson. He grabbed three touchdowns in TCU's 55-52 win against the Red Raiders. Doctson finished the game with 267 yards on 18 receptions. His 18 receptions tied a TCU single-game record. His performance helped him earn national honors as he was named the Walter Camp National Offensive Player of the Week. He's the seventh Horned Frog player to earn the honor since 2004 and is the fifth offensive honoree.
Honorable mentions: RB Aaron Green, TCU (28 carries for 162 yards, two touchdowns; two receptions for for yards and a touchdown in 55-52 win over Texas Tech) QB Seth Russell, Baylor (12 of 16 for 277 yards, six touchdowns; two carries for 27 yards in 70-17 win over Rice), RB Wendell Smallwood, West Virginia (22 carries for 147 yards, TD; two receptions for 23 yards in 45-6 win over Maryland); QB Trevone Boykin, TCU (34 of 54, 485 yards, four touchdowns; 14 carriers for 42 yards in 55-52 win over Texas Tech).
